Job Title

HR Business Partner

Overview

As an HR Business Partner at Humble Bridge, you will play a pivotal role in aligning HR strategies with business objectives. You will work closely with business directors to design and implement people solutions, provide expert counsel on employee relations, and drive HR initiatives in a fast-paced environment. Your role will involve strategic workforce planning, leadership coaching, and fostering a positive employee experience.

Company Overview

Humble Bridge is a leading AI/ML company dedicated to driving digital transformation across various industries. We are committed to innovation, excellence, and creating a diverse and inclusive workplace where every employee can thrive.

Roles & Responsibilities

  • Design and implement professional and commercial people solutions in collaboration with Business Directors
  • Provide counsel on escalated Employee Relations cases and advise on best approaches for resolution
  • Collaborate with the wider HR community to ensure HR policies, initiatives, and procedures meet business needs
  • Gain in-depth knowledge of financial and commercial aspects of contracts to inform People Plan priorities
  • Foster good working relationships with Stakeholders to promote Engagement and enhance working practices
  • Actively monitor data on labour costs, employment relations, and sickness absence to identify trends and risks
  • Identify cost-saving opportunities based on data insights and collaborate with Business Directors on action plans
  • Work strategically with the Head of People to align HR strategies with overall business objectives
  • Manage and drive HR initiatives effectively in a fast-paced and complex environment
  • Handle Employment Tribunal cases and demonstrate strong experience in Employee Relations

Secondary Tasks

  • Support the development and implementation of training programs for employee development
  • Assist in conducting HR audits and ensuring regulatory compliance

Requirements

  • Basic Qualification: Degree in Business Administration, Psychology, International Cultural and Business Studies, or related field
  • Preferred Qualification: Certification such as SHRM-CP or PHR may be preferred
  • Experience: 5+ years in HR management, preferably in a similar role
  • License and Certificates: Certification such as SHRM-CP or PHR may be preferred
  • Language: Fluent in English (business), conversational in German
  • Work Authorization: General knowledge of HR practices and Austrian labor law

Skills

Must-have Skills

  • Technical Skills: HR strategy, workforce planning, succession planning, leadership coaching, labor relations, Employee experience, organizational design, change management
  • Soft Skills: Strong interpersonal skills, excellent written and verbal communication skills, high level of emotional intelligence and empathy

Nice-to-have Skills

  • Technical Skills (Preferred): Familiarity with Microsoft Office and/or Google Workspace
  • Soft Skills (Preferred): Adaptability and flexibility in handling diverse HR challenges

Compensation and Benefits

  • Compensation: Competitive salary based on experience and qualifications
  • Supplement Pay: Performance-based bonuses
  • Benefits: Comprehensive health insurance, paid time off, and retirement benefits
  • We Offer: Opportunities for professional development and career growth in a dynamic and innovative environment

Entry

Immediate availability preferred

Company Info

Interested candidates are encouraged to apply by submitting their resume and cover letter through our careers page.

Address: Humble Bridge, Vienna, Austria

Application Instructions

Please submit your application through our online portal, including a resume and a cover letter detailing your experience and qualifications.

Reporting Line

Reports to the Head of People

Posted Date

October 15, 2023

Measures of Outcome

Successful implementation of HR strategies aligned with business goals, improved employee engagement scores, and effective resolution of employee relations issues.

Work Environment

  • Work Schedule: Standard business hours with flexibility for remote work
  • Travel: Minimal travel required
  • Job Type: Full-time
  • Location: Hybrid - Vienna, Austria
  • Employment Type: Permanent
  • Physical Demands: Primarily desk-based with occasional meetings

No. of Openings

1

Industry Type

AI/ML, Technology

Department

Human Resources

Application Deadline

November 30, 2023

Equal Employment Opportunity (EEO) Statement

Humble Bridge is an equal opportunity employer. We celebrate diversity and are committed to creating an inclusive environment for all employees.

Diversity and Inclusion Statement

At Humble Bridge, we are committed to fostering a diverse and inclusive workplace where all employees feel valued and respected.

Interview Rounds

The interview process includes an initial phone screening, followed by two rounds of interviews with HR and business leaders.

Level

Mid-level
